abstract.p: Beach Bum Press publishes guides to New Jersey beaches; photo (By the Way column) (S)

block.p: Summer may be over, but that never stopped a real beach bum. Those who fit the description can make use of three publications from -- what else? -- Beach Bum Press. ''The Beach Bum's Alamanac of the Jersey Shore'' ($4.95) by Yma Courbash (who put the extra a in almanac) includes a full calendar of weather wisdom and forecasts through next April, fish facts, moon modes, sea lore and cooking tips. ''The Beach Bum's Guide to the Boardwalks of New Jersey'' ($12.95) is by Richard Handschuch and Sal Marino, who say they walked every board in the state. ''The Beach Bum's Guide to the Jersey Shoreline'' ($5.95), also by Ms. Courbash, is subtitled ''The Book That Answers the Question -- What IS That?'' the ''what'' being shells, crustaceans, fish, birds, about 20 types of seaweed, shore and marsh plants, buoy and channel markers, storm flags, clouds and much more. Order from Currents Marketing and Communications, 2101 Central Avenue, Ship Bottom N.J. 09008; (609) 494 5556, currents@att.net.
